trans-unit.source: Optimize your Hive queries for faster execution in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Optimize your Hive queries for faster execution in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to optimize your Hive queries for Hadoop in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to optimize your Hive queries for Hadoop in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hadoop clusters are not optimized for performance.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hadoop clusters are not optimized for performance.

trans-unit.source: This article covers a few of the most common Hive performance optimization methods that you can apply to our queries.
trans-unit.target: This article covers a few of the most common Hive performance optimization methods that you can apply to our queries.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Optimize Hive queries for Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Optimize Hive queries for Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of worker nodes in a cluster can leverage more mappers and reducers to be run in parallel.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the number of worker nodes in a cluster can leverage more mappers and reducers to be run in parallel.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways you can increase scale out in HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways you can increase scale out in HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: At the provision time, you can specify the number of worker nodes using the Azure preview portal, Azure PowerShell or Cross-platform command line interface.
trans-unit.target: At the provision time, you can specify the number of worker nodes using the Azure preview portal, Azure PowerShell or Cross-platform command line interface.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following screen show the worker node configuration on the Azure preview portal:
trans-unit.target: The following screen show the worker node configuration on the Azure preview portal:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>scaleout_1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>scaleout_1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At the run time, you can also scale out a cluster without recreating one.
trans-unit.target: At the run time, you can also scale out a cluster without recreating one.

trans-unit.source: This is shown below.
trans-unit.target: This is shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>scaleout_1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>scaleout_1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more details on the different virtual machines supported by HDInsight, see <linkText>HDInsight pricing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on the different virtual machines supported by HDInsight, see <linkText>HDInsight pricing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Apache Tez</linkText><title></title> is an alternative execution engine to the MapReduce engine:
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Apache Tez</linkText><title></title> is an alternative execution engine to the MapReduce engine:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>tez_1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>tez_1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Tez is faster because:
trans-unit.target: Tez is faster because:

trans-unit.source: Execute Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) as a single job in the MapReduce engine, the DAG that is expressed requires each set of mappers to be followed by one set of reducers.
trans-unit.target: Execute Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) as a single job in the MapReduce engine, the DAG that is expressed requires each set of mappers to be followed by one set of reducers.

trans-unit.source: This causes multiple MapReduce jobs to be spun off for each Hive query.
trans-unit.target: This causes multiple MapReduce jobs to be spun off for each Hive query.

trans-unit.source: Tez does not have such constraint and can process complex DAG as one job thus minimizing job startup overhead.
trans-unit.target: Tez does not have such constraint and can process complex DAG as one job thus minimizing job startup overhead.

trans-unit.source: Avoids unnecessary writes Due to multiple jobs being spun for the same Hive query in the MapReduce engine, the output of each job is written to HDFS for intermediate data.
trans-unit.target: Avoids unnecessary writes Due to multiple jobs being spun for the same Hive query in the MapReduce engine, the output of each job is written to HDFS for intermediate data.

trans-unit.source: Since Tez minimizes number of jobs for each Hive query it is able to avoid unnecessary write.
trans-unit.target: Since Tez minimizes number of jobs for each Hive query it is able to avoid unnecessary write.

trans-unit.source: Minimizes start-up delays Tez is better able to minimize start-up delay by reducing the number of mappers it needs to start and also improving optimization throughout.
trans-unit.target: Minimizes start-up delays Tez is better able to minimize start-up delay by reducing the number of mappers it needs to start and also improving optimization throughout.

trans-unit.source: Reuses containers Whenever possible Tez is able to reuse containers to ensure that latency due to starting up containers is reduced.
trans-unit.target: Reuses containers Whenever possible Tez is able to reuse containers to ensure that latency due to starting up containers is reduced.

trans-unit.source: Continuous optimization techniques Traditionally optimization was done during compilation phase.
trans-unit.target: Continuous optimization techniques Traditionally optimization was done during compilation phase.

trans-unit.source: However more information about the inputs is available that allow for better optimization during runtime.
trans-unit.target: However more information about the inputs is available that allow for better optimization during runtime.

trans-unit.source: Tez uses continous optimization techniques that allows it to optimize the plan further into the runtime phase.
trans-unit.target: Tez uses continous optimization techniques that allows it to optimize the plan further into the runtime phase.

trans-unit.source: For more details on these concepts, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details on these concepts, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You can make any Hive query Tez enabled by prefixing the query with the setting below:
trans-unit.target: You can make any Hive query Tez enabled by prefixing the query with the setting below:

trans-unit.source: Tez must be enabled at the provision time.
trans-unit.target: Tez must be enabled at the provision time.

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample Azure PowerShell script for provisioning a Hadoop cluster with Tez enabled:
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample Azure PowerShell script for provisioning a Hadoop cluster with Tez enabled:

trans-unit.source: I/O operation is the major performance bottleneck for running Hive queries.
trans-unit.target: I/O operation is the major performance bottleneck for running Hive queries.

trans-unit.source: The performance can be improved if the amount of data that needs to be read can be reduced.
trans-unit.target: The performance can be improved if the amount of data that needs to be read can be reduced.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hive queries scan entire Hive tables.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hive queries scan entire Hive tables.

trans-unit.source: This is great for queries like table scans, however for queries that only need to scan a small amount of data (e.g. queries with filtering), this creates unnecessary overhead.
trans-unit.target: This is great for queries like table scans, however for queries that only need to scan a small amount of data (e.g. queries with filtering), this creates unnecessary overhead.

trans-unit.source: Hive partitioning allows Hive queries to access only the necessary amount of data in Hive tables.
trans-unit.target: Hive partitioning allows Hive queries to access only the necessary amount of data in Hive tables.

trans-unit.source: Hive partitioning is implemented by reorganizing the raw data into new directories with each partition having its own directory - where the partition is defined by the user.
trans-unit.target: Hive partitioning is implemented by reorganizing the raw data into new directories with each partition having its own directory - where the partition is defined by the user.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates partitioning a Hive table by the column Year.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates partitioning a Hive table by the column Year.

trans-unit.source: A new directory is created for each year.
trans-unit.target: A new directory is created for each year.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>partitioning</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>partitioning</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Some partitioning considerations:
trans-unit.target: Some partitioning considerations:

trans-unit.source: Do not under-partition - Partitioning on columns with only a few values can cause very few partitions.
trans-unit.target: Do not under-partition - Partitioning on columns with only a few values can cause very few partitions.

trans-unit.source: For example, partitioning on gender will only create two partitions to be created (male and female), thus only reduce the latency by a maximum of half.
trans-unit.target: For example, partitioning on gender will only create two partitions to be created (male and female), thus only reduce the latency by a maximum of half.

trans-unit.source: Do not over-partition - On the other extreme, creating a partition on a column with a unique value (e.g. userid) will cause multiple partitions causing a lot of stress on the cluster namenode as it will have to handle the large amount of directories.
trans-unit.target: Do not over-partition - On the other extreme, creating a partition on a column with a unique value (e.g. userid) will cause multiple partitions causing a lot of stress on the cluster namenode as it will have to handle the large amount of directories.

trans-unit.source: Avoid data skew - Choose your partitioning key wisely so that all partitions are even size.
trans-unit.target: Avoid data skew - Choose your partitioning key wisely so that all partitions are even size.

trans-unit.source: An example is partitioning on State may cause the number of records under California to be almost 30x that of Vermont due to the difference in population.
trans-unit.target: An example is partitioning on State may cause the number of records under California to be almost 30x that of Vermont due to the difference in population.

trans-unit.source: To create a partition table, use the Partitioned By clause:
trans-unit.target: To create a partition table, use the Partitioned By clause:

trans-unit.source: Once the partitioned table is created, you can either create static partitioning or dynamic partitioning.
trans-unit.target: Once the partitioned table is created, you can either create static partitioning or dynamic partitioning.

trans-unit.source: Static partitioning means that you have already sharded data in the appropriate directories and you can ask Hive partitions manually based on the directory location.
trans-unit.target: Static partitioning means that you have already sharded data in the appropriate directories and you can ask Hive partitions manually based on the directory location.

trans-unit.source: This is shown in the code snippet below.
trans-unit.target: This is shown in the code snippet below.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic partitioning means that you want Hive to create partitions automatically for you.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic partitioning means that you want Hive to create partitions automatically for you.

trans-unit.source: Since we have already created the partitioning table from the staging table, all we need to do is insert data to the partitioned table as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Since we have already created the partitioning table from the staging table, all we need to do is insert data to the partitioned table as shown below:

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>Partitioned Tables</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>Partitioned Tables</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Hive supports different file formats.
trans-unit.target: Hive supports different file formats.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Text: this is the default file format and works with most scenarios
trans-unit.target: Text: this is the default file format and works with most scenarios

trans-unit.source: Avro: works well for interoperability scenarios
trans-unit.target: Avro: works well for interoperability scenarios

trans-unit.source: ORC/Parquet: best suited for performance
trans-unit.target: ORC/Parquet: best suited for performance

trans-unit.source: ORC (Optimized Row Columnar) format is a highly efficient way to store Hive data.
trans-unit.target: ORC (Optimized Row Columnar) format is a highly efficient way to store Hive data.

trans-unit.source: Compared to other formats, ORC has the following advantages:
trans-unit.target: Compared to other formats, ORC has the following advantages:

trans-unit.source: support for complex types including DateTime and complex and semi-structured types
trans-unit.target: support for complex types including DateTime and complex and semi-structured types

trans-unit.source: up to 70% compression
trans-unit.target: up to 70% compression

trans-unit.source: indexes every 10,000 rows which allow skipping rows
trans-unit.target: indexes every 10,000 rows which allow skipping rows

trans-unit.source: a significant drop in run-time execution
trans-unit.target: a significant drop in run-time execution

trans-unit.source: To enable ORC format, you first create a table with the clause Stored as ORC:
trans-unit.target: To enable ORC format, you first create a table with the clause Stored as ORC:

trans-unit.source: Next, you insert data to the ORC table from the staging table.
trans-unit.target: Next, you insert data to the ORC table from the staging table.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: You can read more on the ORC format <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can read more on the ORC format <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Vectorization allows Hive to process a batch of 1024 rows together instead of processing one row at a time.
trans-unit.target: Vectorization allows Hive to process a batch of 1024 rows together instead of processing one row at a time.

trans-unit.source: This means that simple operations are done faster because less internal code needs to run.
trans-unit.target: This means that simple operations are done faster because less internal code needs to run.

trans-unit.source: To enable vectorization prefix your Hive query with the following setting:
trans-unit.target: To enable vectorization prefix your Hive query with the following setting:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Vectorized query execution</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Vectorized query execution</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: There are more optimization methods that you can consider, for example:
trans-unit.target: There are more optimization methods that you can consider, for example:

trans-unit.source: Hive bucketing: a technique that allows to cluster or segment large sets of data to optimize query performance.
trans-unit.target: Hive bucketing: a technique that allows to cluster or segment large sets of data to optimize query performance.

trans-unit.source: Join optimization: optimization of Hive's query execution planning to improve the efficiency of joins and reduce the need for user hints.
trans-unit.target: Join optimization: optimization of Hive's query execution planning to improve the efficiency of joins and reduce the need for user hints.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Join optimization</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Join optimization</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: increase Reducers
trans-unit.target: increase Reducers

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned several common Hive query optimization methods.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned several common Hive query optimization methods.
